page.title: 13LOCAL PLACE NAMES #1
page.content: This area of England was mainly settled in Anglo-Saxon times by the Hurvicce people moving up the Avon Valley into the Forest of Arden area.Many place-names thus have a tree connection: {Whitnash,}in the Leamington area means,'area of the white ash trees'. { Bishop's Tachbrook}obtained its name from the ancient boundary-brook (between the dioceses of Lichfield and Worcester) formerly owned by the Bishop of Chester. {Barford,}S.W. of Warwick takes its name from 'the ford of the bear'. { Heathcote,}an area of Leamington means,'shelter by the rough land'. { Park Farm}refers to Warwick Castle Park.{ { Debden Farm} means,'farm in the deep vale'. {
